title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
2 points are earned for f'(x)

f ′ (x)= 1 2 (25- x 2 ) -1/2 (-2x)= -x 25- x 2 , -5<x<5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@558F@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for f'(-3)

1 point is earned for the answer

f ′ (−3)= 3 25−9 = 3 4 f(−3)= 25−9 =4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4BB1@

An equation for the tangent line is y=4+ 3 4 (x+3) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F18@ .

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for considering one-sided limits

1 point is earned for the answer with explanation

lim x→− 3 − g(x)= lim x→− 3 − f(x)= lim x→− 3 − 25− x 2 =4 lim x→− 3 + g(x)= lim x→− 3 + (x+7)=4 Therefore,  lim x→−3 g(x)=4. g(−3)=f(−3)=4 So,  lim x→−3 g(x)=g(−3). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@AFEA@

Therefore, g is continuous at x = -3.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
2 points are earned for antiderivative

1 point is earned for the answer

Let u=25− x 2  ⇒ du=−2xdx ∫ 0 5 x 25− x 2 dx=− 1 2 ∫ 25 0 u du                               = [ − 1 2 ⋅ 2 3 u 3/2 ] u=25 u=0                               =− 1 3 (0−125)= 125 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@A649@
